contentrichtext.text: For the author, see [[Nancy Farmer#Awards|Nancy Farmer]] '''Nancy Farmer''' (born September 11, 1956) is [[Missouri]] politician who was the 43rd [[State Treasurer of Missouri]], serving from 2001 to 2005.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Nancy Farmer|publisher= Clint Zweifel|url=http://www.treasurer.mo.gov/History/NancyFarmer.aspx|accessdate=2010-12-10}}</ref> Farmer was raised in [[Jacksonville, Illinois]] and graduated from [[Illinois College]] there in 1979.<ref name="tmogov">{{cite web | url = http://www.treasurer.mo.gov/history/nancyfarmer.asp | title = Nancy Farmer: 43rd State Treasurer: 2001-2004 | work = [[Missouri State Treasurer]] website | accessdate = 2009-06-23 }}</ref> From 1993 to 1997, she served in the [[Missouri House of Representatives]]. During her tenure in the state legislature, she served as chairwoman of the powerful Ways and Means Committee,<ref name="tmogov"/> Farmer served as Assistant Treasurer under then-State Treasurer [[Bob Holden]] since 1997, then was elected [[State Treasurer of Missouri]] herself in November 2000. She was the first woman to hold both posts.<ref name="tmogov"/> She was the unsuccessful [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] candidate in the [[United States Senate election in Missouri, 2004|2004 United States Senate election in Missouri]], running against incumbent [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] [[Kit Bond]]. ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box| before=[[Tom Stoff]]| title=[[Missouri House of Representatives|Missouri State Representative - District 64]]| years=1993–1997| after=[[Bob Hilgemann]] }} {{succession box| before=[[Bob Holden]]| title=[[State Treasurer of Missouri|Missouri State Treasurer]]| years=2001–2005| after=[[Sarah Steelman]] }} {{s-ppo}} {{s-bef|before=[[Jay Nixon]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] nominee for [[List of United States Senators from Missouri|United States Senator from Missouri (Class 3)]]|years=[[United States Senate elections, 2004|2004]]}} {{s-aft|after=[[Robin Carnahan]]}} {{s-end}} {{MOTreasurers}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Farmer, Nancy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1956 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Farmer, Nancy}} [[Category:Members of the Missouri House of Representatives]] [[Category:State treasurers of Missouri]] [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Illinois College alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Jacksonville, Illinois]] [[Category:People from St. Louis, Missouri]] [[Category:Women state legislators in Missouri]] [[Category:Missouri Democrats]] {{Missouri-politician-stub}}
